thread.title: Guinness World Records makes a ruling on the largest wave surfed; video
thread.title_full: Guinness World Records makes a ruling on the largest wave surfed; video

author: Ryan Brower
title: Guinness World Records makes a ruling on the largest wave surfed; video
text:
Guinness World Records makes a ruling on the largest wave surfed; video 
March 23, 2017 By Ryan Brower 
It may have happened back in 2011, but this week Garrett McNamara’s 78-foot Nazaré wave was officially confirmed by Guinness World Records as the largest wave ever surfed. 
A panel of big-wave experts and photographers analyzed the footage with Guinness World Records and named the 2011 wave the “Largest wave surfed” finally. But, as SURFER points out , McNamara’s own 2013 wave at Nazaré could break it any day now. 
Plus, not to mention all the entries we saw from earlier this month on one of the biggest swells to hit Nazaré. 
It’s certainly a validation for McNamara, as he admitted : “Since that time, the Guinness World Records title acts as a kind of ‘seal of legitimacy’ — it makes me very proud and humble all at once.” 
RELATED: Surfers charge massive waves as big-wave spot Nazaré lights up 
We wouldn’t be surprised to see him eventually beat his own record, or someone from this year (or recent years) taking the title away from him in the near future. But it might take some time (like this official ruling did), as the waves at Nazaré are not the easiest to judge in size since they don’t break top-to-bottom like most other waves. Garrett McNamara’s 78-foot wave at Nazaré from 2011.
